data.name: Parsing JSON leaves
data.description:
Your task is to develop the json_leaves function, which takes a json string as input and returns an array with the fully qualified name of each leave followed by an equal sign and it's value.

For arrays you should use the `[0]`, `[1]`, `[2]`, `[x]` notation.

Example

Given

```json
{
  "name": "john",
  "age": 22,
  "colors": ["red", "green", "blue"],
  "title": null,
  "validated": true,
  "location": { 
    "lat": 12.3, 
    "lng": 34.5 
  }
}
```

Should return the following array:

```crystal
[
  "name=\"john\"", 
  "age=22", 
  "colors[0]=\"red\"", 
  "colors[1]=\"green\"", 
  "colors[2]=\"blue\"", 
  "title=null", 
  "validated=true", 
  "location.lat=12.3", 
  "location.lng=34.5"
]
```

```javascript
[ 
  'name="john"',
  'age=22',
  'colors[0]="red"',
  'colors[1]="green"',
  'colors[2]="blue"',
  'title=null',
  'validated=true',
  'location.lat=12.3',
  'location.lng=34.5' 
]
```

Take into account that the function should handle deeply nested objects and arrays.
